availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William E. Arthur (Kenton County, Kentucky, attorney & commw'th atty)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, attorney. Cincinnati, Ohio, native. Son of William Arthur and Eliza Parsons Arthur. Married to Adeliza Southgate Arthur. Father of W. E. Arthur, Jr. Married to Ethalinda Southgate Arthur. Father of Sidney Arthur and Ada Arthur. Attorney in Covington in 1850. Commonwealth attorney for the ninth judicial district of Kentucky from 1856 to 1862. Employed Sarah Gibbers and Mary Kirk as servants in Covington in 1860. Presidential elector on the Democratic ticket of Breckinridge and Lane in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 4, p. 263A.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 4, p. 257A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994027-994058: Kenton County Births, p. 35.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #7012984: Covington Deaths, Certificates 1-723 (1897), File #233, p. 252 of microfilm.
